attributes.action: Increase pressure to provide vital aid and evacution to the people of Aleppo.
attributes.background: The people of East Aleppo are being slaughtered. Before our very eyes via social media, hundreds are dying from the bombardment of the city. In recent days, the situation has become even more apocalyptic - the British Government simply must do more to help these people, by providing aid and escape.

attributes.action: Force all councils to have an adequate quantity of lorry parks for lorries.
attributes.background: Lorry driving is a stressful . The best way of helping drivers deal with this is for them to get adequate rest. There are not enough spaces in the majority of service areas. Councils should be compelled to provide enough parking and adequate services to accommodate the amount of traffic.
attributes.additional_details: There are not enough lorry parks in the UK and the vast majority of them have woefully poor services such as showers and decent food vendors. The majority of them have fast food outlets which encourages unhealthy eating etc. Getting proper rest areas would make the roads safer and provide good business opportunities as almost all haulage firms are prepared to pay the fees.

attributes.action: Stop the time limits on disabled and elderly bus passes.
attributes.background: The rules on a disabled or elderly bus pass is telling people who have them what times they can and can't take a bus journey Its discrimination and absolutely embarrassing to be turned away and declined to take your journey before 9am! Why have the bus pass holders got a bus pass curfew? Fair/Unfair
attributes.additional_details: Contact your local Council and ask for information on times you can use your bus pass. Its like we have to be controlled and they tell us what we can and can't do.

attributes.action: Amend the Trade Union Act 2016 to remove trade union immunity from damages.
attributes.background: RMT & ASLEF have been striking for no discernible aim other than to cause harm to the commuters that use Southern Rail. They have wreaked untold costs upon individuals, families & businesses, yet they have legal immunity from the laws that govern every other person & organisation in the country.
attributes.additional_details:
This advantage that gives unions legal immunity from any claims for damages arising from their behaviour, however destructive, is wrong. Even the government has been taken to court by an individual before being allowed to invoke article 50, yet someone that loses their job because of persistent union action has no recourse to the courts, it is unjust and unfair. 

Unjustifiable strikes must stop, unfair advantages must stop.
 
Please help to get the Trade Union Act 2016 amended and remove the unfair trade union immunity from damages.

attributes.action: Allow 14-15 year olds to consent to sex with someone a maximum of 3 years older
attributes.background: The age of consent is currently 16, and therefore those aged below 16 are prohibited from engaging in sexual; whether protected or unprotected. My proposal is that 14 year olds should be allowed to engage in sexual activity; but only protected, and with partners who are no more than 3 years older.
attributes.additional_details: The age of consent in the UK has been 16 since 1885. Sex education has improved since 1885, and so 14 year-olds nowadays are capable of consenting to safe sex and understand the implications. Most countries in Europe have a lower age of consent than we do, which has led to calls to reduce ours. However, I believe that this is a dangerous move with paedophilia being so common today, and so I believe that my proposal is the best option. Various US states follow legislation similar to my proposal.

attributes.action: All PMs must state that their duty is to enact the will of the people, not God.
attributes.background: All incoming PMs should be required to publicly confirm that their primary duty is to the electorate and to reaffirm their commitment to their election manifesto.
attributes.additional_details: This petition is not an attack on the right of acting MPs to hold personal religious beliefs. Rather, it is intended to remind our leaders that, in their public capacity, they are ultimately answerable to the electorate and that the manifesto commitments they've made to voters supersede the demands of their personal faith.

attributes.action: Investigate the link between 3G Football pitches and cancer.
attributes.background: 3G Football pitches are made from crumb rubber, pellets of which are often made from used car tyres, which contain toxic chemicals. It has been suggested that if these chemicals enter the body through, for example, cuts or scratches then they can contribute to Cancer.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/35585392
http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11095/10154596/report-claims-link-between-3g-pitches-and-cancer

attributes.action: Make it law that qualified electricians are allowed to break seals on cutouts
attributes.background: It is time that us electricians of which are highly trained and aware of electricity at work act do our jobs.
attributes.additional_details: Jobs can become more expensive and time consuming relying on an already over stretched national grid.  Just as BT had to open openreach allow electricians the right for basic electrical connections and force national grid to sell new seals.

attributes.action: Never sign a trade deal like CETA/TTIP which cede UK sovereignty to corporations
attributes.background: Once Brexit has completed, the UK will be able to enter into trade deals by itself. Ministerial support for TTIP/CETA which are aimed at eroding national sovereignty and giving multinational corporations the right to sue governments if policy adversely effects their profits is a serious danger.
attributes.additional_details: The main tenet of the Brexit campaign was to "take back control" from the EU. UK ministers have voiced strong support for CETA/TTIP which seems contradictory given that such trade deals put the sovereignty of government in doubt and give corporations the ability to sue governments under Investor-State Dispute Settlement powers before special international tribunals. This would effectively bring an end to the cherished principle of equality before the law, all in the name of greater profits.

attributes.action: Special funding to Councils for social housing for adults with disabilities
attributes.background: Many local authorities have social housing problems... but more so for adults with physical disabilities and/or learning disabilities (who may require shared living). Where housing associations have stepped in to provide properties they charge rents far beyond what is affordable on housing benefit.
attributes.additional_details: Many social housing properties are in disadvantaged areas with high crime, making them unsafe for many adults with learning disabilities, or properties are ill suited for the person's physical disabilities... this results in many people having to continue living wth parents long into adulthood... with complex care needs that place unsustainable pressure on the family relationship increasing the risk of crisis or carer breakdown.

attributes.action: Move the Ministry for Exiting the EU to Northern England
attributes.background: It is important that the ministry has a good appreciation of the needs of the economy outside the S.E. of England where a great deal of the regeneration and products produced for export come from. It would help in the building confidence in and reinforcing the Northern Powerhouse.
attributes.additional_details: The re-balancing of the economy will be an important component of restructuring the economy after Brexit, the industrial areas of the north had traditionally been part of the successful rise of Britain as a global superpower.

attributes.action: Let the victims decide who should next head the Westminster abuse.inquiry.
attributes.background: Someone who is trusted or members of the public should put forward respectable candidates from which the victims should choose the head of the inquiry. The main qualification required by potential candidates is integrity.
attributes.additional_details: WE MUST HAVE ANSWERS

attributes.action: Present a draft UN resolution that would implement a no fly zone over Syria.
attributes.background: UK to call on all civilised nations of the world (via the United Nations) to draft a UN resolution that would implement a no fly zone over Syria and would apply to ALL aircraft of Syria, Russia, and lran for the purposes of military operations until the complete and total cessation of hostilities.
attributes.additional_details:
Over 3000,000 people have now lost their lives in this conflict. The UN has officially declared Aleppo as besieged. Russian and Syrian forces and their allies must not be allowed to continue to flout international law and bomb civilians, civilian infrastructure, hospitals and aid operations. Since the breakdown of the recent cease-fire on September 19 over 500 civilians have been killed in Aleppo alone, with at least 100 of those being children.
Sources: 
www.unicef.org
www.syriahr.com
and more

attributes.action: The Royal Marines Calendar should be allowed
attributes.background: Allow the Royal Marines to release thier annual calendar to raise money for essential charities. If the government cannot fund the charities the Royal Marines want to support, then allow them to raise the money by making a calendar!

attributes.action: Stop development of new fossil fuel reserves to comply with the Paris agreement.
attributes.background: See for example : https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2016/sep/27/fracking-digging-drilling-paris-agreement-fossil-fuels

attributes.action: Raise the fine for using a handheld device at the wheel to £1,000.
attributes.background: The Press states that the fine for using a handheld device at the wheel will be doubled from £100 to £200.   For a car owner / driver this is ridiculously small.   I believe that the Government should raise the fine for such dangerous behaviour to at least £1,000.   Breaking this law should hurt!

attributes.action: Scrap HS2, and build the best internet system in the world instead.
attributes.background: HS2 makes no difference to the vast majority and solves old world issues. The disruption over a long period make the cost uncertain, with little benefit to the vast majority of the public and industry. Let's build the very best internet instead and make the UK the worlds leading tech nation instead!
attributes.additional_details:
Fixing overcrowded railways will turn out way same as fixing overcrowded motorways, the more you build the more crowded they become. With driverless cars around the corner, let's jump a stage ahead and move commercial traffic to the railway system and focus on making commercial communication better with the best internet the world has seen so far.
We and the next wave of innovators would all benefit from the side effect of hyper fast and super efficient internet in ways not even thought of yet.

attributes.action: To reduce fraud, Banks must match Name to the A/C No. before Auth. transactions!
attributes.background: Currently UK banks only check if the sort code and account number is correct before a transaction is authorised. This opens vulnerabilities for fraudsters to exploit the system. In some other countries, if the name does not match the account then the transaction is rejected.
attributes.additional_details:
The UK Government must make this a statutory requirement.

Example case: 
MARY has building work done by JOHN. JOHN's email is compromised by fraudsters who send MARY payment request to be paid into an account who they say is under JOHNS name. MARY makes a bank transfer to the account and puts JOHN SMITH as Payee. Because the account number is correct the payment is accepted by the receiving bank. The actual account holder is JOE BLOG. Money is immediately withdrawn. The banks do not reimburse Mary.

attributes.action: Increase tax allowance to £14,976 per year so minimum wage pay no tax on income
attributes.background: We believe this would encourage people back into full time employment whilst reducing benefits claims to a degree. This action may influence our economy as there would be potential for more disposable income.

attributes.action: Mothers who are domestic abuse victims should rightfully gain custody of child
attributes.background: Are you a mother trying to protect your child and yourself from domestic abuse? Please sign this petition.
attributes.additional_details: Mothers who have become a victim of domestic abuse should have full parental responsibility over their children. And fathers' rights to visitation should be on the mother's terms to safeguard both mother and child from the most common outbursts, physical and emotional abuse and controlling demands.

attributes.action: Allow airport staff with a valid ID to carry 2 x liquid bags through security.
attributes.background: Everyone is allowed 1 x plastic bag of liquids 100ml or less weather staff or passengers. However, I would like staff to be allowed 2 x plastic bags of toiletries as this will help with especially Cabin Crew where they have nightstops away and don't want to take a suitcase - PLEASE SIGN & HELP!

attributes.action: Statutory Adoption Allowance for Self-Employed
attributes.background:
Employed people who adopt are entitled to the same 39 weeks paid leave as those who give birth.
Self Employed parents are entitled to 39 weeks maternity allowance. Which amounts to £5,443.62.
A Self Employed parent who adopts receives no statutory allowance.
attributes.additional_details:
Whilst some parents may be able to contact the local authority for help this is not in any way guaranteed.
As part of the adoption procedures the prospective parents have their finances inspected and so the majority of parents are reluctant to ask for financial help in fear that it jeopardises their application

attributes.action: Abolish NHS referral system that controls access to private medical treatment.
attributes.background:
The control is costly & unnecessary. Individuals should be given freedom to choose to go to specialists, privately, straightaway if wished.

Benefits: 1. Options to patients; 2. Lesser queue. 3. Free up time & cost from referral mgmt. 4. Promotes healthy competition among private & NHS.
attributes.additional_details: Long waiting time for GP appointment. Hospital A&E won't see me as it is not an emergency, however painful. Can't reach specialist doctor privately, without GP referral. Walk-in clinic can't refer. As patient, I suffer until it turns into an emergency. I was willing to pay for my treatment; I had medical insurance. Then why such situation? Sounds familiar? Sign the petition.

attributes.action: Use UK National Lottery to support the NHS and Care homes.
attributes.background: It's distressing to read and hear about the problems with our NHS services and the closures of Care Facilities and Homes for the Elderly, such distress can only continue for so many if these problems persist.
attributes.additional_details: Alternatively, why also doesn't the government introduce a NHS Lottery which is solely for the running of the NHS and associated causes like care for the elderly?

attributes.action: Pay off all NHS PFI's outstanding, raised by this and previous governments.
attributes.background: PFI's raised by previous governments means that the NHS is paying off enormous interest at rates agreed by those governments and not by the NHS. Our taxes which should be going to the NHS are being used to pay off these interests instead of being used to cure the patients.
attributes.additional_details: John Major started the NHS PFI's and Blair/Brown continued to use them as a way to build hospitals with no cost to the government. The cost is being born by the NHS, on which these contacts were forced, and it is our money that is being used to pay off the eye watering interest payments.

attributes.action: Charge patients for not attending NHS appointments.
attributes.background: Hundreds of patients miss appointments at local GP's and Hospitals without valid reasons, who then go on to take beds in A&E when they could have been treated at their Doctors or pharmacies. For missing these appointments, without valid reasons, i believe people should pay a fine.
attributes.additional_details: People who fail to turn up or miss appointments at hospitals and local GP's, without valid reasons, should be fined or sent a bill. It is increasingly difficult to get appointments at GP's and the waiting list in Hospitals gets ever longer. By fining these people who waste these appointment not only would you raise revenue which can be invested in the NHS but would make people think twice before avoiding appointments and potentially keeping people out of A&E.

attributes.action: Stop the closure of Fairfield Hospital A & E Dept.
attributes.background:
We, the undersigned demand you stop the proposed closure of the A & E Department at Fairfield General Hospital, Bury, Gt Manchester.
This already overworked A & E serves a population of over 355,000 people from the home town of Bury and the surrounding towns of Heywood, Rochdale & Rossendale.
attributes.additional_details: The nearest A & E’s to these towns if Fairfield closes are Oldham ( approx 12 miles from most homes, Blackburn, 11 miles from Rossendale and North Manchester General,  10 miles)   all of which are completely overstretched due to cutbacks in surrounding areas and virtually inaccessible to anyone without a car.

attributes.action: Introduce and enforce a trade embargo on Saudi Arabia.
attributes.background: Saudi Arabia have an appalling human rights record. Homosexual acts are punishable by death and women are treated legally as second class citizens. In addition to their medieval society, there is evidence that the Saudi regime funds Sunni terrorists organisations. We cannot do business with them.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/saudi-arabia/local-laws-and-customs
"The Saudi legal system differs in many ways from the UK. Suspects can be held without charge and are not always allowed quick access to legal representation. The Saudi authorities have detained witnesses and victims of crimes."
"It is illegal for women to drive."
"The public practice of any form of religion other than Islam is illegal"

attributes.action: Burglaries should attract a minimum of a five year prison sentence.
attributes.background: Ordinary citizens are having homes and businesses burgled or cars taken under threat of violence. It is time the judiciary put our safety and well-being above the offender. Hand out lengthy prison sentences and provide in-prison rehabilitation programmes to break the offenders criminal cycle.
attributes.additional_details: Then,following prison release criminals should be made to pay for the cost of their prison stay even if they are on benefits. Make them pay a minimum of £5 per week.

attributes.action: Instead of inviting Donald Trump for state visit, redirect funding to NHS
attributes.background: Instead of inviting Donald Trump for state visit, redirect funds to much needed NHS

attributes.action: A better awareness of endometriosis within NHS and treatments available.
attributes.background: It can take years to diagnose condition, lack of understanding and knowledge within communities, more information and support available for sufferers, it may not be cancer but this is a slow crippling disease affecting your body and mind.

attributes.action: Increase NI contributions and % of Gov. spending to meet the demands of the NHS.
attributes.background: The BBC were allowed into A&E depart. of the Royal Blackburn Hospital to witness the desperation of both patients and staff over a week. More investment in staff and accommodation was suggested by a consultant as a way forward. We should pay more for this invaluable institution which we all use.

attributes.action: Delay the Disability benefit cuts due in April 2017
attributes.background: These cuts will have a devastating effect on one of the most vulnerable and needy groups

attributes.action: Invoice embassies based in the U.K. for NHS costs incurred by health tourists
attributes.background: The NHS is in danger of collapse. It cannot afford to treat people who come to the U.K. for healthcare and then refuse to pay for their treatment which often runs into hundreds of thousands of pounds. I believe that the country of origin should be held responsible and be made to pay.
attributes.additional_details: A recent documentary highlighted three cases, a woman from the Philipines who needed a quadruple heart bypass, a Turkish man in a similar situation and a woman who had fertility treatment abroad and after being refused entry to the USA, came to the U.K. and ran up a bill of over £300,000 at a London hospital. Three cases, almost £1,000,000 which will never be repaid and could be better spent on staff, services and equipment to treat people who qualify.

attributes.action: Introduce a 'political awareness test' to allow minors to qualify for the vote.
attributes.background: This idea arrived after the recent Brexit-Bremain debate when many minors felt their vote would have impacted the descision to stay or leave the European Union. The idea is also inspired by the positive impact 16 and 17 year olds had on the Scottish Refferendum. The test would allow minors to vote.
attributes.additional_details: Introduce a political awareness test which would allow citizens under the age of 18 to vote (after qualifying) in all forms of election across the UK. A test like this would eliminate the argument that minors do not know politics and therefore can't be trusted with the vote. If the minor was to pass the test, proving there awareness of politics, then they would qualify to have the ability to vote in any domestic election before age 18. The default voting age will still remain at 18.

attributes.action: Overhaul the honours system, so only selfless acts of compassion are rewarded
attributes.background: Famous people, people in power and people with money shouldn't get on the honours just because they're in those positions. It's prejudicial. They need to earn it, doing things outside their normal jobs, helping people and the community within our country. Otherwise the honours are meaningless.
attributes.additional_details: The list should be for those who help protect the country and support it outside of their paid duties. Just being rich or doing a job you're paid to do shows innate produce prejudice for the elite. We should encourage compassion and community spirit and love of our country, but the current system teaches us that if you're in the elite, or you're friends with the PM, that's all that matters. It's not supposed to be there as the PM's private thank you card.

attributes.action: Give Au Pairs employment rights in the UK.
attributes.background: Au pairs come to the UK to learn English and experience a new culture living in with a family. In return for ones accommodation, one will help in the home and with the children for a small 'pocket money' token. In reality, this is a job and should have employment rights like all other employment.
attributes.additional_details: The laws for Au Pairs & Host Families need addressing as they are non-existent. AP's can work in excess of 60 hours per week, being paid anything from £35 per week, with no paid holiday or right to minimum wage. The Gov states AP's ''are unlikely to be classed as a worker or an employee.'' But why? A Nanny or cleaner are entitled to employment rights so why not AP's? It will protect both host families and AP's to have employment law to fall back on should either side need it down the line.

attributes.action: Ban the use of Body Mass Index (BMI) as a measure of obesity by NHS
attributes.background: Set in 1830 by a non-medical mathematician and astronomer, BMI is an inaccurate measure of body fat content and does not take into account muscle mass, bone density, overall body composition, racial and sex differences. When Johnny Wilkinson won the RWC he was officially overweight according to BMI.
attributes.additional_details: There is an urgent need for accurate tools to measure fat and skeletal muscle, and biomarkers that can better predict the risks of diseases and mortality. Advances to improve the measurement of obesity and related factors will help determine the optimal weight for an individual, taking into account factors such as age, sex, genetics, fitness, pre-existing diseases, as well as novel blood markers and metabolic parameters altered by obesity. (Ahima and Lazar, Science, August 2013)

attributes.action: Temporarily ban breeding of domestic animals until UK pet crisis is manageable.
attributes.background: We believe preventing breeding of domestic animals for monetary gain will decrease the number of animals living in cages. Why when there are so many animals without homes are we letting people keep breeding more?. They clearly have no thought for the animals, just the money they can make.
attributes.additional_details:
It is our societies decisions that have led to the number of abandoned animals increasing year on year. Rescue centres are overwhelmed  and it is our responsibility to change this.
102,363 stray and abandoned dogs were handled by local Authorities between 2014-2015, and the RSPCA alone rescued almost 119,000 animals.

attributes.action: Cap private rent in line with local council rent. End the housing crisis.
attributes.background: It's time something was done about the astronomical prices of renting a house through a private landlord. Fat cats,are buying all the houses, then renting at inflated prices.  If it was capped in line with council rent. The housing crisis would be helped significantly.
attributes.additional_details:
How are the next generation supposed to get on the housing ladder. Massive private rents mean, no savings.  Therefore no deposit. And in many cases,  living hand to mouth. 
The housing crisis could be eased, if rent wasn't allowed to be inflated by the greedy affluent property owners/developers. House prices would fall and settle at an affordable level.  And the greedy wouldn't want them so much if they weren't allowed to extort money from the less well off

attributes.action: Make it law to wear helmets on bicycles skateboards and roller skates
attributes.background: To many fatal injuries that could be avoided if a helmet was worn
attributes.additional_details: Most children in the UK think it is a bit silly to wear helmets. In New Zealand it is the law to wear safety helmets if you are on any thing with wheels and as it is the law no child seems to mind wearing them.

attributes.action: Force Airlines to offer nut free meals as an option.
attributes.background:
People with nut allergies can die of anaphylactic shock if they ingest nuts. Whilst it is possible to order Kosher, Muslim, Vegetarian, reduced salt etc etc meals. Not one airline will offer nut free meals as an option. 

It should be a legal requirement to make a nut free option available.
attributes.additional_details:
Here is a list of the "Special Meal" options from British Airways:-

Type of meal

Lacto-ovo-vegetarian,
Vegan/vegetarian	
Asian/Hindu vegetarian
Muslim 
Kosher
Child meal	
Diabetic
Gluten intolerant	
Low calorie	
Low fat	
Low salt	
Low lactose

The above are meal choices. Yet someone who cannot eat nuts is not catered for. It is unreasonable for people on long haul flights particularly children to be denied safe food to eat.

attributes.action: Increase funding for the NHS!
attributes.background: Our NHS is in crisis at the moment! Some patients are waiting in corridors on trolleys for hours, waiting for treatment. Nothing is currently being done about it, yet it is risking numerous peoples lives. 1,000's of surgeries are being cancelled. PLEASE SIGN TO SAVE THE NHS AND INCREASE SPENDING!
attributes.additional_details: The NHS is an amazing service which allows free healthcare for all and saves millions of lives each year! Each year, especially during winter, there is a struggle for resources but this year it is a lot worse than usual and risking patients lives. Thousands of surgeries are being cancelled due to there being no beds available which could be causing a persons life expectancy to drop dramatically. PLEASE SIGN THIS TO SAVE OUR NHS!

attributes.action: Change the Discretionary Payment income cap.
attributes.background: The discriminatory payment income cap is much too low. A disabled family on all appropriate benefits falls much higher in income bracket to the aloud £15,000. This is discrimination against severely disabled families, as these people  successfully applied for community care grants and crisis loans.
attributes.additional_details: I myself have spoken to a member of the staff at the Discretionary Payment office and was refused a grant on the basis that my income was too high. The reason for my income being so high was not because of work or anything of the like, was simply because my daughter is so severely disabled and on high rate DLA that she was also entitled to disability component of child tax credit's. That entitlement to the disability component of child tax credit's is what put my and come over.  Discrimination.

attributes.action: Senior Ministers should be available to mainstream media during crises...
attributes.background:
With self-evident crises (like the NHS or Southern Rail) the Minister with that brief should be directly answerable. 
I have lost count of the number of times I've heard phrases like 'we asked for a comment but no one was available.'
attributes.additional_details:
Clearly we don't need to interrogate Ministers on their shoes or their trousers (leather or not) - this would be petty. 
When something serious is unfolding, however, they should be immediately available and answerable.
Some Ministers (eg Jeremy Hunt) seem to see their job as some kind of sinecure: not good enough. 
We don't need written statements - they can't be interrogated. Nor a junior sacrificial lamb (eg Chris Philp). We need the Minister with overall responsibility.

attributes.action: UK Government to hand control of the Severn bridges to the Welsh Assembly.
attributes.background: Control of the Severn bridges needs to be handed to the Welsh Assembly, who have unanomously voted to abolish the tolls. This would greatly help the Welsh economy.

attributes.action: Reduce or abolish university fees
attributes.background: The rising fee of University fees is leaving many students in massive debt or maybe even putting off the chance to attend higher education. this then leaves unbalance of social class such as the more well off students are attending whereas the less well off aren't able to.

attributes.action: Introduce ecig workplace regulations to stop discrimination against vaping
attributes.background: Hundreds of workplaces are rightly, making policies to include ecigs. The trouble is that some policies are stating that vaping must be in smoking shelters. It is putting vapers at risk and forcing them off the premises to remain smoke free when the smokers have a shelter.
attributes.additional_details: Vaping is not smoking, therefore vapers should have their own rights and not be discriminated against or put at risk of passive smoking.

attributes.action: Use some of the foreign aid budget for the care system instead of council taxes
attributes.background: Use some of the foreign aid budget for the care system instead of council taxes

attributes.action: Pay Special Guardianship carers the same rate as foster carers.
attributes.background: We both work full time jobs but almost 50% of my partners annual salary goes on child care cost. We should not have to be financially punished for wanting to work or cover the cost in traveling to arrange visits with the natural birth parents.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.communitycare.co.uk/2015/07/23/special-guardianship-orders-misused/
